name: glob
description: Searches for files matching a glob pattern within the simulated workspace.

pattern.description: A glob pattern for matching files, such as `*.py`, `**/*.md`, or `src/**/*.ts`.

path.description: An optional directory to search in, relative to the workspace root; defaults to the workspace root.

name: list_directory
description: Lists the direct children of a specified workspace directory.

path.description: Absolute directory path to list, which must be within the workspace root.

name: read_file
description: Reads the content of a text file with optional line-range pagination.

path.description: Absolute path to a file within the workspace.

offset.description: The 1-based line number to start reading from; requires `limit` when set. Defaults to the start of the file.

limit.description: Maximum number of lines to read when `offset` is set. Defaults to 2000.

name: write_file
description: Writes content to a specified file, creating parent directories if needed.

file_path.description: The absolute path to the file within the workspace root.

content.description: The content to write to the file, replacing any existing content.

modified_by_user.description: Optional flag indicating whether the content was user-modified.

name: search_file_content
description: Searches file contents for a regular expression pattern within a specified directory (or workspace root if unspecified).

pattern.description: A valid regular expression pattern to search for within file contents.

path.description: Optional directory to search in, relative to the workspace root; defaults to the workspace root.

include.description: Optional file pattern to include in the search (e.g., '*.py').

name: run_shell_command
description: Executes a shell command in the simulated workspace.

description.description: A brief description of the command's purpose.

directory.description: The directory in which to execute the command, relative to the workspace root; defaults to the root.

background.description: Runs the command in the background (not currently implemented).

name: web_fetch
description: Fetches content from a given URL.

url.description: The URL to fetch content from.
